column4: im having a problem trying to install ubuntu server from a usb drive on a machine that has no cd-rom. is a cd-rom required?
theres ways around it, booting usb isn't always simple to work
i have noticed. i have litterly spend days trying to get this going
eww
not matter what i try i cant get linux installed on this box
do you have an existing linux box to play with things on?
i have a desktop and pc with ubuntu desktop.
err desktop and laptop
cool
i have tried server 10.04 9.10 desktop 10.04  non will get though an install
oh but you can get them booted?
i did at one point have server 10.04 on and working but i used a bad command and screwed it up, so i just thought i would reinstall. but thats not happening
have you tried a network install?
no i havnt

yeah the OS loads. right after you do the keyboard selection it runs a quick progress bar that says detecting pc devices then it just sits at a blue screen. then when i restart i get a menu that only alows me to do cd-rom detection options
and with 10.04 desktop after i hit install it goes to the ubuntu splash screen and never goes any further
the cdrom detection options is odd, never seen that personally
is this a laptop thats giving you trouble?
no its a tower
im just trying to set up a file server, mabey a proxy on it. so it had 6 hdd 1gig ram 2.8ghz amd
installing server should JustWork(tm) :-/
yep. right now i am actualy stuck on that progress bar. it says Detecting hardware to find CD-ROM drives. 0%
http://paste.ubuntu.com/439578/
thanks man, ill try it out
